subject: Economics
title: The Green Revolution: How Science Fed the World
description: A quick win: understand The Green Revolution: How Science Fed the World.

hook.text: In the 1960s, experts predicted mass famine in India and Asia.

buildup.text: The Green Revolution: new crop varieties, fertilizers.

discovery.text: India went from importing grain to exporting it. Famine predictions were replaced by food surpluses.

twist.text: The Green Revolution had costs: chemical fertilizers polluted water, monocultures reduced biodiversity.

climax.text: The Green Revolution proved technology can solve development problems at scale.

punchline.text: Science saved a billion lives. Now we need science that shares the gains.

quiz.question: What was the Green Revolution's main achievement?
options: High-yield crop varieties and modern techniques tripled grain production, preventing predicted mass famine across Asia
